title: 1,692 new cases, 27 dead in Himachal Pradesh

title: Increase testing for Covid-19: Himachal CM
description:
Himachal Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur on Monday directed all the Deputy Commissioners to increase the number of testing in their respective districts.

He also asked them to follow the strategy of testing, tracing and treatment with effective surveillance through micro containment zones.

title: Himachal Pradesh Minister Offers His Nursing Institute For Covid Care
description: Himachal Pradesh Forest Minister Rakesh Pathania on Monday offered his family's nursing institute to be used as a COVID-19 care centre.

title: COVID-19: Online registration a must to enter Himachal Pradesh
description: The order was issued on Sunday by the state health secretary under the HP Epidemic Disease (COVID-19) Regulations, 2020 Online registration has been made mandatory from Tuesday midnight for people wanting to enter Himachal Pradesh, a state government notification said.

title: Attempt being made to spread misinformation on phase III of COVID-19 vaccination drive: Harsh Vardhan
description: Addressing concerns raised by some quarters on the recently announced 'Liberalized and Accelerated Phase III Strategy of Covid-19 Vaccination', Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan on Sunday took a swipe at "certain political leaders" from the Opposition and said they are indulging in "needless politics" and spreading "misinformation".

title: Breaking News April 26
description: This IndiaToday.in Breaking News April 26 blog brings to you the latest breaking news from across India and the world. Find all the latest news updates from across the country and world as they break.

description: Coronavirus LIVE: Mumbai reported 5,888 new Covid cases on Saturday evening - a three-week low and a significant drop from the 7,221 it reported on Friday, the 7,410 on Thursday and the 7,684 on Wednesday. Delhi government mulls at extending the lockdown for another week as Covid cases continue to surge in the national capital.

title: 842 Covid cases, 9 deaths in Himachal Pradesh
description: As many as 842 Covid cases were reported in the state today, taking the tally to 74,195. Besides, nine persons died of the virus in the past 24 hours. Three deaths each were reported in Hamirpur and Shimla and one each in Una, Mandi and Sirmaur.

title: Negative RT-PCR report needed to enter Himachal Pradesh from today
description: Travelers from Punjab, Delhi, Maharashtra, Gujarat, Karnataka, Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh need to produce an RT-PCR negative report, the government said.

title: Central University of Himachal Pradesh shuts campuses amid Covid surge
description: Amid the unrelenting surge in Covid-19 cases in Himachal Pradesh, particularly Kangra, the Central University of Himachal Pradesh (CUHP) has shut all its three temporary campuses for offline academic activities

title: COVID-19: Negative RT-PCR test mandatory for people coming to Himachal from 7 states
description: People coming from Punjab, Delhi, Maharashtra, Gujarat, Karnataka, Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh will have to show that they have tested negative for coronavirus in the preceding 72 hours while entering the state

title: Himachal Pradesh: NIT Hamirpur asks students to vacate hostels as 19 test positive for COVID-19
description: In Himachal Pradesh, 19 students have been found covid positive at National Institute of technology (NIT) in Hamirpur district following which authorities have asked the students to vacate hostel in order to contain further infection.

title: ICMR asks states to share data of genome sequencing of SARS CoV2 virus

title: Tourists will not be ‘harassed’ for COVID-19 test report at Himachal Pradesh border: CM

title: Former Himachal Pradesh CM Virbhadra Singh tests positive for Covid | Shimla News - Times of India

title: Former Himachal Pradesh CM Virbhadra Singh tests positive for COVID-19
description: Senior Congress leader and former Himachal Pradesh chief minister Virbhadra Singh has tested positive for Covid-19. Himachal Pradesh reported 9 Covid-19 deaths and 1,089 new cases on Monday, while 380 patients recovered.
